what: Supporting ‘a new wave of ggplot2 extenders’
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: growing population ggplot2 ‘super-users’ – given regular long-term ggplot2 use – strong working knowledge grammar graphics principles ggplot2’s user interface. Among ranks statistics educators, data visualization professionals, data scientists statisticians. assertion project many ggplot2 super-users find creating ggplot2 extensions valuable, current educational materials falling short reaching enabling many group. ’ll discuss new material tailored group introduce new points entry. easy geom recipes: diving defining compute_group ggprotos geom recipes: cases compute_group enough (compute_panel) ggtedius workshop Coordinating ggplot2 extenders meetup/support group

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Hello welcome! ’m data scientist educator ’s especially passionate using visualization facilitate communication statistical learning. ’m particularly motivated elegance power “Grammar Graphics” framework, exploring empower ggplot2 users take advantage extension space 1) working new extension packages statistical education 2) providing new points entry ggplot2 world (tutorials/recipes well community building). last three years, ’ve worked Dean’s Data Cell United States Military Academy West Point data analytics teaching dual role. worked closely stakeholders members data team deliver actionable insights meet institutional reporting requirments. worked Deans Data Cell infrastructure towards, code-first, reproducible elegant data products. also taught sections MA206 Introduction Statistics Probability Mathematics Department, oversaw five independent studies focused tool-building statistical education (2X Fall AY2022, 1X Spring AY2022, 2X Spring AY2023). Fall AY2018-Spring AY2020, taught statistical methodology University Denver’s Josef Korbel School International Studies Visiting Teaching Assistant Professor, previously lectured Technische Universität Dresden’s Center International Studies (Spring AY2016 Spring AY2018). PhD University Illinois, dissertation won Burkholder Award Best Dissertation Political Science Department University Illinois. focus international institutions law especially area security. broadly, areas study International Relations, Methodology, Comparative Politics emphasis Latin American Politics. dissertation focused compliance supranational law, focusing UN Security Council resolutions principle case; conducted dissertation field research Brazil Federal House Deputies. Phd, worked statistics consultant, Applied Technologies Arts Science (ATLAS), University Illinois 2013-2015. also served “Methods TA” Political Science 2015-2016 academic year University Illinois, providing assistance expertise undergraduate graduate students. TU Dresden, 2018, designed taught course introducing students data science tools statistical analysis political research. awarded Fulbright Fellowship (Argentina 2008), Foreign Language Area Studies Fellowships (2009-2011), Nelle Signor Travel Fellowship (Brazil 2011) participated specialized workshops including Empirical Implications Theoretical Models (2010), Public Policy Nuclear Threats (2013), Berkeley Institute Transparency Social Sciences (2015) workshops, Zurich Summer School Women Political Methodology (2017), Lorentz Workshop: Empirical Research International Organizations (2018). Previously academic career, worked U.S. Department Commerce’s Bureau Industry Security chemical biological export controls worked lithium-ion battery failure diagnostics Chemical Engineering Division Argonne National Laboratory.
